# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    # Push the last line
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Here is an example usage:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Phasellus id sem turpis. Sed nec nunc at urna dictum aliquam. Integer fermentum erat ut tortor mollis lobortis."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Phasellus id sem turpis. Sed nec nunc at urna dictum aliquam.
Integer fermentum erat ut tortor mollis lobortis.
```
